H0.text: Limited is the best description of wind energy.

H1.text: Renewable is the best description of wind energy.

H2.text: Damaging is the best description of wind energy.

H3.text: Inexpensive is the best description of wind energy.

A4.text: Wind power consumes no fuel, and emits no local air pollution, unlike fossil fuel power sources.

A5.text: In many locations, new onshore wind farms are cheaper than new coal or gas plants.

A6.text: Wind power is one of the lowest-cost electricity sources per unit of energy produced.

A7.text: Wind turbines have some of the lowest life-cycle greenhouse-gas emissions of energy sources: far less greenhouse gas is emitted than for the average unit of electricity, so wind power helps limit climate change.

A8.text: The power available from the wind is a function of the cube of the wind speed, so as wind speed increases, power output increases up to the maximum output for the particular turbine.

A9.text: Wind energy was the leading source of new capacity in Europe, the US and Canada, and the second largest in China.
